article.description: The Memphis Grizzlies made just one field goal in the final three minutes and remained the league's only winless team with a 99-95 loss to the Minnesota Timberwolves.

images.name: Brown Hubie 021113 inline
images.caption: Hubie Brown answers questions during Wednesday's news conference.

related.description: Hubie Brown had one compliment after another for Jerry West and a few for his new team.
related.linkText: Brown: I could not say no to Jerry West
related.title: Brown runs first practice for Grizzlies
related.headline: Brown runs first practice for Grizzlies

article.headline: Szczerbiak's late surge spoils Brown's re-debut

images.name: Brown Hubie 021115 inline
images.caption: Hubie Brown patrolled an NBA sideline for the first time in 15 years.

article.linkText: Wolves hold off winless Grizzlies, spoil Brown's re-debut
article.story:
MEMPHIS, Tenn. (AP) -- Two days of practice under the direction of Hubie Brown weren't enough for the Memphis Grizzlies to reverse their losing ways. Wally Szczerbiak scored six of his 22 points in the final two minutes to spoil Brown's return to the sidelines as Minnesota defeated Memphis 99-95, handing the Grizzlies their ninth straight loss. "We asked a lot,'' said Hubie Brown, who returned to coaching after 15 years away. "We're very happy with what they did in two days and how they accepted the hard work.'' Brown began working with the Grizzlies on Wednesday, one day after former coach Sidney Lowe resigned with Memphis the only winless team in the NBA. They're still winless (0-9), but the Grizzlies put up a spirited fight. Memphis trailed by only one point when Szczerbiak hit a 3-pointer with 28 seconds left to give the Timberwolves a 97-93 lead. It was Minnesota's only 3-pointer of the evening. Kevin Garnett led the Timberwolves with 28 points. Gordan Giricek led Memphis with 25 points, and Drew Gooden added 18. The Grizzlies were tougher on defense than they have been for much of the season. Memphis point guard Jason Williams, criticized for slacking off on defense, often picked up his man in the backcourt. "That's the first time I ever played defense like that in my whole career,'' Williams said. "It's not like I can't do it. I don't have a choice. It's either do it or sit on the bench and I don't like sitting on the bench.'' Minnesota coach Flip Saunders said he expects the Grizzlies to get better under Brown, but not right away. "They're not going to reap benefits early,'' Saunders said. "They'll reap them late in the year and next year.'' Brown, an NBA coach of the year in 1978, coached the Atlanta Hawks and the New York Knicks. He left coaching in 1987 and spent the past 15 years as a TV basketball analyst and director of coaching clinics. Brown said he planned to focus early on improving the Grizzlies' defense. Upon his arrival, Memphis was allowing an average of 104 points a game and letting opponents shoot 46.6 from the field, the worst in the NBA.

Game notes
Brown said his first game back coaching was particularly special with his wife, Claire, in the stands and his son, Brendan, beside him as an assistant. ...The Grizzlies put forward Robert Archibald (back strain) on the injured list and activated center Cezary Trybanski, who made his first appearance. ... Guards Michael Dickerson and Brevin Knight remained sidelined with injuries. ... The Timberwolves won on the road for the first time in five tries.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
